intro: Erythronium maximum, commonly known as the giant cowslip, is a striking bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It features large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often with a red or orange tinge at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often mottled with green and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and forested areas. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a notable early bloom in its habitat.
